org.konelabs.stroll.graphics
Class AbstractGraphics<DLayer extends AbstractGBALayer>

java.lang.Object
  org.konelabs.stroll.graphics.AbstractGraphics<DLayer>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, IPlayClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
GBAGraphics
public abstract class AbstractGraphics<DLayer extends AbstractGBALayer>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPlayClient, java.lang.Runnable

Represents a virtual screen; this base class contains all of the synchronisation methods to maintain a constant speed for the screen as well as managing the interrupts.

Constructor Summary
protected AbstractGraphics(int width, int height)
           
 
Method Summary
 void destroy()
          Informs the Screen to cease to exist, system may exit before destroy completes, but in implementations where the program will not System.exit(0) then it is important that destroy() will close any resources and stop any threads.
protected abstract  void drawLayers(int[] buffer)
          will draw all of the Screen's layers to the specified buffer on the current line.
 int getHeight()
          returns the height of the screen
abstract  DLayer getLayer(int num)
          returns the given layer; null is returned if the layer is not loaded
abstract  int getNumLayers()
          returns the number of screen layers
 IGBAGraphicsViewer getScreenViewer()
          returns the associated screen viewer.
 int getVCount()
          returns the vertical line

          returns the width of the screen
 boolean isHBLEnabled()
          returns whether HBL is enabled
 boolean isInitialized()
          states whether the screen is initialised; if not then the screen is not likely to start
 boolean isVBLEnabled()
          returns whether VBL is enabled
 void run()
          Initiates the screen's drawing methods, and synchronises itself with the vertical blank (60hz).

          returns whether HBL is enabled

          sets the vertical blank listener
 boolean start()
          When IScreen.start is called the screen begins; returns whether start was successful
 void stop()
          stops the screen after rendering the current frame
 void waitVBL()
          Makes thread of the calling method wait for the vertical blank.
